content: Definitely! While acoustic guitar may be the most common acoustic instrument used in rock music, mandolin and harmonica are also frequently used. For example, Led Zeppelin's "Going to California" prominently features a mandolin, while Bob Dylan's "Like a Rolling Stone" is well-known for its harmonica solo. Acoustic instruments can add a unique and organic sound to rock music, and many musicians enjoy experimenting with different instruments to create their own unique sound.
